process.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
process.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Repetition can help the learning process.
the mental processes involved in decision-making
Getting fit again has been a long slow process.
process.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a series of things that happen naturally and result in gradual change
process.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Coal forms by a slow process of chemical change.
process.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a method of making or producing goods
process.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Collecting the data is a slow process.
Try to be patient through the long process of healing.
The copying of manuscripts was a laborious process.
Getting a visa can be a complex process.
A decision will only be taken after a formal consultation process.
Cats have different mental processes from dogs.
The student is actively involved in the learning process.
They are frustrated with the lack of progress in the peace process.
Not all staff can participate in the decision-making process.
An interview normally forms part of the selection process.
A lot of companies are going through a process of change.
The system underwent a process of simplification.
We encourage our clients to participate in the process at every stage.
process.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to make food, materials, or goods ready to be used or sold, for example by preserving or improving them in some way
process.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Goats’ cheese may be processed in many ways.
Two million workers are employed processing goods for electronic firms.
process.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way
process.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: All university applications are processed through this system.
process.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to deal with information using a computer
process.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The new network will enable data to be processed more speedily.
process.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to print a picture from a photographic film
process.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to walk or move along in a very slow and serious way, especially as part of a group
process.translation[3].definitions[0].de: a series of actions taken to perform a particular task or achieve a particular result
process.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Industry executives said ABC’s plans would slow down the process.
the union’s disciplinary and electoral processes
process.translation[3].definitions[1].de: to have started doing something that is not yet finished
process.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: General Motors is in the process of beginning discussions with potential partners.
process.translation[4].definitions[0].de: to change a substance as part of the manufacture of a product
process.translation[4].definitions[0].ex: The refineries are processing 1.4 million barrels of crude oil a day.
The paper will be processed from pineapple and banana leaves.
process.translation[4].definitions[1].de: to deal with a document in the usual way
process.translation[4].definitions[1].ex: The service was started to help process copyright permissions more rapidly.
The Securities Industry Automation Corp. processes stock quotations from the major exchanges.
process.translation[4].definitions[2].de: if a computer processes information, figures etc, it uses them to produce a particular result
process.translation[4].definitions[2].ex: the accounts are processed by the Systems Union Sun Account system.
facilities for changing, deleting and processing data
